oai_dc:dc.dc:description: ||kabbo describes the seclusion of the 'growing' (or menstruating) girl in a hut with a tiny door by her mother: she has to lookeep her eyes on the ground when she leaves the hut and cannot go far. When she is 'grown' she is allowed to look about and leave the hut and walk about like other women.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The treatment of the 'growing' girl
